He valued the wrong clashes in the debate. He didn’t track much of the debate, and only tracked what he thought was interesting. He said we took too soft a stance and didn’t value any other clashes within the debate saying they were “washes” even though the other team didn’t respond to it, which were incredibly important and didn’t matter wether the stance was soft or not either.

She gave a debate with THBT, based on implementation on the system; similar to a THW motion and not the way that a THBT motion should be run Completely disregarded the arguments we brought, had no clashes in OA, did not consider the arguments or the responses and the lack of responses Made the case for the other side and drew the links for them Wasn't paying attention during the round And prioritised the wrong things This is the worst OA I have ever heard with no actual mention of the case nor the arguments and analysis that either side said

The judge did not provide any clear reasoning for the decision that was made. When we requested explanations and clarification regarding the key clashes in the debate, the judge merely asked us to identify our clashes, then stated that we had not addressed them sufficiently. The judge seemed to place significant weight on remarks made during the opposition's reply speech and toward the conclusion of the third speech, but failed to explain how this influenced the overall outcome of the debate. Ultimately, no reasoning or justification was provided for the final decision.

tournament.motion:
This House would kill the murderer

You are a low-ranking policeman working in a city with highly-corrupt authorities. A clinically insane mass murderer has been apprehended, and you are helping to transport him to an asylum to be detained. The murderer has escaped from this asylum before and you strongly believe that he will escape again.
This House prefers a world which values acquired relationships (e.g. friendships, mentorships, romantic partnerships, etc.) more than familial/blood ties

This House believes that Sri Lanka should revert to constituency-based Parliamentary elections rather than maintaining proportional representation

Currently, Sri Lankan Parliamentary elections are contested under a proportional representation (PR) system. Under PR, each province is allocated a quota of seats, voters select one party to vote for, and select the politicians they prefer from the list of candidates nominated by that party. Seats are then allocated in the province based on what proportion of votes each party received, with priority being given to candidates with the most preferential votes.

Prior to 1977, Sri Lanka operated under a constituency-based system, where political parties would nominate one candidate per constituency. Constituencies operated under a first-past-the-post (FPTP) system, where the candidate who wins the most votes wins the constituency.

This House believes that it is in the interest of the Catholic Church to abandon the doctrine of “divine inspiration” of the Bible, in favour of one that admits it was written by flawed human beings

Divine inspiration is the doctrine in Christian theology that the human writers and canonizers of the Bible were led by God with the result that their writings may be designated in some sense the word of God. This belief is traditionally associated with concepts of biblical infallibility.

In the case of juvenile crime, This House believes that criminal records should be expunged after reaching the age of majority.

Expungement involves treating criminal records as though they never existed. An expunged record is physically and digitally destroyed, and all documents in relation to the arrest, detention, and sentencing must be permanently destroyed.
This House opposes queer stories that largely focus on sex
This House believes that there is no inherent moral obligation to follow the law

This House, as Sri Lanka Cricket, would prioritise Women’s cricket over Men’s cricket.

The current Sri Lankan men’s cricket team has faced significant backlash following their crushing defeat in the 2023 Asia Cup final on home soil. Despite receiving substantial funding, the team has experienced coaching changes, significant disciplinary issues, and a reduction in international tours. Meanwhile, the women’s team is performing well, albeit in a comparatively smaller circuit. The women’s team won the 2024 Asia Cup, with captain Chamari Athapaththu recently becoming the first Sri Lankan women’s player to play international franchise cricket. However, the women's team remains underfunded and limited in their opportunities to participate in more international tournaments. Although there have been improvements to increase their winning salaries, it remains significantly lower than their male counterparts.
tournament.question: Did you agree with their decision?
How carefully did the judge track content brought out by speakers in the debate? (0-10)
How well did the judge organize the content in the debate into clashes during their OA? (0-10)
How well did the judge evaluate and weigh the clashes (0-10)
